thread.title: Amazon Prime: £20 off you first £50 order if you live in London
thread.title_full: Amazon Prime: £20 off you first £50 order if you live in London

author: Chantelle Symester
title: Amazon Prime: £20 off you first £50 order if you live in London
text:
Get money news by email Invalid e-mail Thanks for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Find out how to save £20 off your order with Amazon Prime 
Online retailer Amazon is offering special discounts for customers who sign up to its Amazon Prime service and order via their app. 
For those who use Amazon regularly it can be a great way to get extra benefits and save on costly delivery charges, which are free via Prime. 
New customers can save up to £20 off any orders over £50 when purchased through the Prime Now app (download from here Apple App store here or Google Play here ). 
You can redeem your code here to use at checkout for the discount until 30 September 2015, and check eligible postcodes for the free delivery offer. 
What is Amazon Prime? Find out in our FAQ . 
Prime members can now get delivery within one-hour for £6.99, or within a two-hour, same-day window for free, from 8am - midnight. 
Save on family essentials with Amazon Prime service What do you get with Amazon Prime? 
The premium service from Amazon offers members a number of great benefits for £5.99 a month including: 
Unlimited free one-day delivery on millions of eligible items 
Unlimited streaming of more than 15,000 movies and TV episodes with Prime Instant Video 
Free unlimited photo storage with anywhere access 
Borrow from thousands of Kindle titles for free 
Read one of four pre-release Kindle Books for FREE each month 
No minimum order size 
Share your delivery benefits 
If you're looking for more ways to save at Amazon, read our guide here . For more news on general saving, offers and discounts visit our regularly updated deals page here .
